abstract.p: Cia Siderurgica Nacional, or CSN, in move that is expected to stimulate growth in Brazil's mining and steel industries, agrees to sell its 42 percent controlling stake in Cia Vale do Rio Doce, or CVRD, one of world's leading iron ore producers, to two other big Rio Doce institutional shareholders that will in turn sell their CSN stake to large institutional shareholder in CSN (S)

block.p: In a move that is expected to stimulate growth in Brazil's mining and steel industries, the steel maker Cia. Siderurgica Nacional, or C.S.N., reached an agreement to sell its 42 percent controlling stake in Cia. Vale do Rio Doce or C.V.R.D., one of the world's leading iron ore producers, to two other big Rio Doce institutional shareholders that will in turn sell their C.S.N. stake to a large institutional shareholder in C.S.N. The deal, worth about $2 billion, will greatly simplify the structure of both companies and is expected to attract new investment.
